Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Rabbit neutrophil peptide 1 (original name MCP-1; NP-1, Arg-rich; natural AMPs; rabbit alpha-defensin,  UCSS1a; mammals; animals; 3S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: neutrophils and Macrophage, lung, Rabbit,Oryctolagus cuniculus

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: R: 30%; C: 18%.Activity: log deduction after 20 min incubation with 50 ug/ml peptide. Active against S. aureus strains 566, 502A, J.F. (reduction 2.3->4.1 logs), S. epidermidis UCLA-622 (reduction >4.1 logs), S. pneumoniae Type III (reduction 3.8 log), S. agalactiae Type I-A or III (reduction 2.3-3.9 logs), L. monocytogenes 450 (reduction 2.1 logs), P. aeruginosa PAO579 (reduction >4.2 logs), E. coli ATCC 29648 (reduction 1.9 logs), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (reduction 3.0 logs), S. marcescens (reduction 1.0 log), H. influenzae Type 3A (reduction >1.1 log), B. bronchiseptica UCLA-342 (reduction 0.1 log).  Also, active against C. neofonnans ATCC52817 (MIC 0.93ug/ml), C. neofonnans ATCC 36556 and ATCC 52816 (MIC 3.75ug/ml). NP-1 is effective in directly neutralizing herpes simplex virus type I (HSV-1).Antimicrobial robustness: Activity is pH-sensitive (little activity at pH 5.8). pH-sensitive:S. agalactiae; pH-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:K. pneumoniae; NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (100 mM); NaCl-sensitive:S. typhimurium (100 mM); NaCl-insensitive:L. monocytogenes; NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans (100 mM).Chemical modification:  Three disulfide bridges.Updated C Wang 4/2019; ref/activity  7/2021; 11/2024
Literature Information.Author: Lehrer RI, Selsted ME, Szklarek D, Fleischmann J. 1983
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial activity of microbicidal cationic proteins 1 and 2, natural peptide antibiotics of rabbit lung macrophages.
